intro: Phyteuma cordifolium, commonly known as the heart-leaved phyteuma, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, blooming in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting flowers and compact growth habit.
